intro: Cremanthodium nobile, commonly known as the noble cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
